items.title: Upcoming Tests Friday, September 19 - Science Topic 1 test Tuesday, September 23rd - Language Arts - Grammar Workshop…
items.details: Upcoming Tests Friday, September 19 - Science Topic 1 test Tuesday, September 23rd - Language Arts - Grammar Workshop Unit 1 L1-8 Monday, September 29th - Social Studies - Topic 1 Reading. Complete pages 114-115 in the my view book Complete the definition paper (DUE WEDNESDAY) The story in the book is Cocoliso https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aGrbVelGJOI Please watch the video and become familiar with the story. I have assigned a story on American Crocodiles Please complete BEFORE FRIDAY! Some students did not submit their answers. Please answer every question and SUBMIT. Go to www.readworks.org/student Enter our class code YU6GQ2 Your password is 1234 unless you already changed it PLEASE TRY YOUR BEST TO LOG IN AND GIVE AN ANSWER. PLEASE DO NOT WRITE KOREAN OR WRITE ‘I DON’T KNOW’ The spelling words for next week are dream amazing bored discovery proud pilot swamp mammals hummingbird shortcut clinic manatee crocodile rare scientist Please revise them before Friday. You borrowed some new books from the library. Please try to have a regular reading pattern and complete the AR quizzes after you read each book. Math Complete Additional Practice 3-2 Please have your child practice a little Khan Academy math each night at https://www.khanacademy.org/join/VK6QDS9E to help strengthen their skills. Some people have not logged into Khan Academy! Please make this part of your daily routine. Science Read and complete pages 34-39 Here is a blooket you can practice for the test! The questions are similar to the test. https://play.blooket.com/play?hwId=68c78a9e9a08a844bb252aab This Friday is the science test! To prepare, you need to read all the pages related to forces and motion (Pages 6-49) What is motion https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hjIptNnEguI&t=26s Patterns in motion https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Yg_1ddUnvmw Forces and Motion https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1R6MxJpEjfs&t=39s Balanced and unbalanced forces https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_-yzCNniwuw Korean Page 110-114 Chinese Complete the Chinese writing. Chinese test next Tuesday.
